front.note: Confidential: not for distribution. Submitted to IOP Publishing for peer review

docTitle.titlePart:
Systematic study of QCD matter with flow of
identified particles at RHIC

front.div:
Abstract. The anisotropic flow of identified particles provides a powerful tool to
study the properties of the hot and dense matter which is believed to be created at
RHIC. It can be used to study different particle production mechanisms in heavy ion
collisions. The recent measurements of anisotropic flow of identified particles at RHIC
will be reviewed in this paper, including light flavors (i.e. strange hadrons) and heavy
flavors. Topics such as number of constituent quark scaling, parton energy loss, and
jet conversions will be discussed in this paper.
